\maketitle

\begin{abstract}
With the Komar mass formula we calculate the electromagnetic energy for a charged
Kerr black hole in a uniform magnetic field. We find that the total electromagnetic
energy takes the minimum when the Kerr black hole possesses a non-zero net charge
$Q = 2\xi B_0 J_H$ where $B_0$ is the strength of the magnetic field, $J_H$ is the
angular momentum of the black hole, $\xi$ is a dimensionless parameter determined
by the spin of the black hole.
\end{abstract
